Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Restaurant ambiance
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front end bra.. and nothing better than pretty girls what great customer service, servicing you drinks

icErC0FQClS0poNnF__uEA.text: We (party of 3) arrived at 6:15 on a Wednesday. The place was packed, but since we had a reservation we were seated right away. I was also happy to find out that all of their rolls are half off 5:30-7 Monday and Wednesday. Score!   For dinner we started with the Dumpling Dim Sum. It was served with 4 pork gyoza and 4 shrimp shimai with a side of sweet chili and fish sauce. Both were delicious.   We also ordered a variety of rolls, but my favorite was that tuna wrapped roll. The tuna was fresh and delicious. We also got the potato roll (recommended), but I wasn't blown away. It's essentially like eating a giant French fry. I personally don't care for deep fried sushi and would rather have fish instead.   The most unique roll of the right was the kiwi roll. We even saved the sweet chili sauce from the dumplings and dipped the roll in it. Game changer!!   The let down for me was surprisingly the lobster roll ($24 reg). The roll was tiny compared to the others and double in price. Other than it having lobster in it, there wasn't much to it.   Overall you can't go wrong on half off night, however I think I'll only return for half off at the bar area and for a drink or two.

QX1LuKCjKaBc6bzuCMX6aA.text: We went on a Tuesday at 5 PM and received amazing service and the best sushi in Charlotte.  They don't pile 8 lbs of sauce on their rolls like other places around here do. The ingredients are fresh and the flavors come together perfectly.  We tried about 8 different things that I'm too lazy to type out, but every single item was delightful.  Our server was knowledgeable, helpful and super sweet. We can't wait to come back!

mChyA3JOElsQsvpUeSSeEg.text: Best sushi in Charlotte, and they make a mean cocktail. Impeccable service, delicious rolls and chef specialities, and beautiful atmosphere. Great for dates, special occasions, and literally any else

fYcH05ovmjtc-BhiIe348Q.text: Overall a great experience.  It was our first time dining there, our waitress was very helpful in suggesting sushi rolls. We chose the spicy tuna, spider roll, potato roll and the duck buns.  It was also my husbands birthday,  they gave us dumplings on the house!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

Znk1gjvp7TFyxKY4SeDTvA.text: This place is gooooood.  Yes it is trendy. And I guess you could say it is expensive, although by our standards it certainly wasn't. This is quality, fresh, well done sushi in a trendy, fun hot spot. It is hopping!  But the rolls and sushi were amazing and fresh and tasty and we had to stop ourselves from pigging out worse than we did!  This is sushi extremely well done. Even what we would consider NORMAL here was extraordinary!!

ihPZqf2bw_2UlMPZl_befQ.text: I absolutely O-Ku The first week it opened we went Sunday and came back on Monday for the 1/2 Sushi (also on Wednesdays) because it was that good. The second time we at the Sushi Bar- pretty cool if you want to watch your sushi be made. They also serve local beers- my fave's is the Hornet's Nest. The next time we went Greg Olsen and his wife visited so, if Mr.Reliable is gracing O-Ku, I'd say his word is pretty-reliable ( it's OK to laugh or shake your head in dismay). This a quality sushi place and with a great selection for alcoholic drinks. I have no doubt they will be expanding their space or to another location very soon.

ijaYdftjJaN9KHmNAA-GUg.text: This is my favorite upscale sushi/Japanese restaurant.  Upbeat atmosphere and excellent service always. Delicious and unique entrees, very fresh sushi. You must try the Tuna or Salmon belly.  If you want to splurge do the Okamase, chefs choice about 6-7 courses, you will not be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Okamase

vwyeZueNhgu5fiNJtdKgHw.text: O-Ku... the new Southend Japanese resurant is flipping heads at their fresh cuisine. I've been twice, both times it's been good. It's top five Japanese restaurant in Charlotte.   The decor is modern, super trendy (so the chairs are a little uncomforable). The food is unequivically Japanese (this is one of the few places where you can actually get fresh wasabi in Charlotte) and it's well executed. I think the best way to experience it if you go with a few people and do it tapas style.

PyMMfdO8pMfpZK80MYb3Qg.text: Excellent addition to the South End neighborhood. This is a solid place for a dinner date or a cocktail. Very trendy, kind of urban chic atmosphere. The place was packed on Friday night.    The wine and food are fairly pricey, but good. Bottles of wine range from $45-$110 per bottle and sushi rolls range from $11-$25.   I highly recommend the south end shrimp appetizer and the potato sushi roll. Both were fantastic.   Though pricey, the food, atmosphere, and location are great. I'll be back, especially for half price sushi night on Mondays and Wednesdays.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuxedo cake was outstanding.

Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

57c7seTuKgFMeZY2icRvBQ.text: Came here on a Thursday night and it was packed! All the hype about this place lives up to it. Beautiful modern decor with lots of space. Fast and attentive service and polite staff. Started with a few cocktails and they were well balanced. As for food, we started with the lobster temaki which was a sizzling plate of lobster and mushroom goodness. Also has the wagyu tartare which I could finish myself. We had the black magic roll and it was very good. You have to try it first without the soy sauce and wasabi to appreciate the taste. The mermaid roll was probably the best part of my meal!  Just a very well put together roll with all of my favorite things! The bowl of chirasi was a bowl of seafood freshness. Each piece melts in your mouth. Cheers to the executive chef!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bowl of chirasi
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu tartare

r4bocJiMnTXSnwOhQPY4wA.text: sushi was average, overpriced like crazy.. our server was amazing the pork belly and the dessert was the best part of the meal.. I'm a sushi chef myself in this place not that good...

5-DcRPM6juDZDamzSr_S4A.text: Celebrating a big birthday with my father meant only one thing, with Omakase at O-Ku. This was my first and recommended by my brother, we landed ourselves here. If you've never had Omakase, it's basically dishes selected by the chef. You're not going to pick and choose, it's a set meal that the chef makes. That eliminates all the indecisions, and all the complications of looking at a menu and seeing what you're interested in. For people with indecisions, this is a perfect meal and experience that should definitely be noticed.  Now, in order to get Omakase, I would definitely, DEFINITELY, call ahead as I believe you can only get 4 seats at the bar at a time. Not only are there other sushi chefs that are fulfilling other orders for the restaurant, this experience is limited.  What you'll be rewarded with your hard time of getting a spot will be a 7/8 course meal.  It ranges from some sashimi/nigiri to wagyu beef, which was what I had served with this delicious sauce. I can't speak of what you'll be served, but what I was served it was great! The price of this was $150/seat, which considering of other Omakase, that's not a bad price. If you have a special occasion and you like Japanese food, I would say go for it.

2FMCsRO9HrOc0srTMIVt_A.text: I love O-Ku sushi and their ambiance and service. However, their food can be a little bit pricey and their rolls can be particularly small. I was excited about half price roll time, but the rolls came out as a regularly sized sushi roll except for cut in half. It was disappointing in the size category, but the taste DEFINITELY made up for it! Their service is amazing, every hostess and waiter I have ever had has been so sweet. Their chirashi bowl is my personal favorite while their sushi rolls are also amazing. I have been here three times in the past month despite the expenses! My family and I love O-Ku.

w6RQuxB_ykRt_3Ngb_utqQ.text: My boyfriend and I ate at O-Ku for the first time sunday night. We got a few rolls including the spicy rainbow roll, the spicy tuna roll, and the mermaid roll. Personally, I don't like my sushi flash fried so I did not enjoy the mermaid roll but my boyfriend loved it! However, I enjoyed everything else. I was so thrilled to find such a good sushi place right next to home! We will definitely be back.

ldOtNPhNlDGFzEZlrglCRQ.text: Yesss! Charlotte can try the best Wagyu sushi here. Very elegant and trendy atmosphere. A great sushi place with quality fresh pieces. We got a great recommendation for our Sake, the bottle was great. There are other things on the menu but I'll definitely go there just for sushi. The prices are a little high for Charlotte but I'm glad they have some half priced lunches that people just can try this place.

yqy4XBSR9tk6d5Ge1GfUDg.text: Simply delicious. My favorite place to get sushi in Raleigh and CHARLOTTE. Out of this world food and service.

hBbyLfgO-uYtjaYviB6RUA.text: Wag Yu Beef nigiri (I didn't order it but I heard it was worth the $11), Lobster Hand rolls (hands down our favorite ), uni Pasta (too bad they didn't have uni so they replace it with candied bacon , really wish they had the uni though) , sashimi tacos  (nothing special, wouldn't order it again), poke bowl (looked nice but small portion) and duck  buns(tasty).  Ambience was cute...I'd say it's more so date night appropriate. Lighting is moody. Exceptional service! The staff and management seemed very attentive during our experience. Will be back!

i4vBd29xD9AmJOZQHs5ulw.text: Best sushi I've had so far in charlotte!!!!!  Loved everything about it.  Will absolutely be coming back.

1bfRva4b2YvMO37HZogC7g.text: O-Ku is such a great sushi spot, especially for date night. My husband and I walked in on a Friday night and were able to grab 2 seats at the bar, there were tables open as well, though. The bartenders were incredibly friendly and helpful. I went with the bourbon basil berry lemonade and he got the shogun. Both drinks were delicious. I also feel like they're great cocktails for only $11 each.   We started with the dumpling dim sum, and it was a nice size to share. The flavor of the dumplings was great, especially the shrimp ones. We had a bunch of pieces of nigiri along with the negitoro roll and the potato roll. The nigiri was so fresh and delicious. We recently went to Japan and I was on a bit of a salmon nigiri bender while there, and the one at O-Ku took me back it was so good. The negitoro was also great, I wish it had just a little more tuna, but it was still worth it. The potato roll is more of a treat, it's a little heavy so it's nice to share, but the potato outside was crispy and awesome. The service throughout our meal was excellent and we had such a nice time. The ambience here is also dark and romantic, a nice place to relax with a drink. This will definitely be a regular sushi spot for us!

YRf8cKBxjvlFljC1g5zcuA.text: Had reservations for Saturday evening, sat promptly but took waiter forever to get to table. He then screwed up the martini order and after a long wait, he even ended up spilling one drink on the table. Ordered 3 appetizers, only the salad came out, 20 minutes later the other 2 appetizers finally showed up, along with another salad. At this point we asked for the manager, who promised to get involved. Ordered another round of drinks, only one came out. After an hour the entrees finally started to arrive. Both orders of dim sum were cold, the shrimp sushi was crusted & with heads, the chicken teriyaki had the consistency & taste of rubber. Between the dismal service & mediocre food, it was one of the worst meals I have ever (attempted) to eat. The only positive was the manager taking a few items off the bill.

HIZUPlVuqx4YAxQOtj5zOg.text: Their rolls are good. Sashimi and some other dishes are too pricey for what you get. But I took my visitors out there twice and always had good experience with their service and accommodation.

hnZpvzhxgKE2A9wQwYAs4A.text: Ok, 3.5 would be my actual rating here.  This is a solid place, bumped up a little because of the deal they are offering mondays and Wednesday's with half price sushi from 5-7.  Also bumped a little more because Reggie our server was awesome,  really nice guy, hooked us up with great service.  I would have been disappointed had we had to pay full price but at half off this is similar to a buy one roll get one free place in plaza midwood.  Decent sushi here, nothing special.  Sushi guru is my top sushi spot in town and this did not live up.  This place reminds me quite a bit of Baku near south park mall.  Prices would make you think the sushi is top notch here, the offering makes you question.  I would come back for half off time but never full price.

m_QIviWaYs0czOtdKSMkUA.text: This is the best sushi we've had since moving to Charlotte! The rolls were the perfect size and had just the right amount of sauce - not too much, but you didn't need any soy sauce since they had a lot of flavor on their own. We really liked all 4 rolls we got. The atmosphere inside was very trendy.  They have half price sushi on Mondays and Wednesday's, which would be a great time to try this place since the sushi is a little pricey.

4VbtgfwsO2EfXGZu-JNphg.text: AMAZING!!! Went with a group of six people . It was back at the end of summer so I don't recall what we ordered but it all excellent. Food and service were exceptional.  This is a classy establishment with a great bar and stocked wine list. Can't wait to go back !

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

bTdo5iTctrhSXUQp4Vp6cg.text: During my tenure in Charlotte, I only visited O-Ku once, but I have to say out of the limited choices for sushi restaurants in the Uptown area, it's probably your best bet.    The ambience here is definitely on the upbeat and trendy side - even on a Tuesday evening it was pretty bumpin'.  I was probably here for like 4 hours or something and never did I feel like the place was getting too quiet or anything like that.  I would recommend making a reservation since it seems like the place gets pretty crowded... actually, it could have been Restaurant Week, which would explain why it was so busy... but my memory fails me.  The decor is modern - place is dimly lit but not so dark that you can't see your food or your company.   Service was pretty good, if I recall correctly.  As for the food - we got an assortment of several different things ranging from spicy edamame, some appetizers, to an assortment of their finer sushi.  The spiced chili edamame was a good concept, but the sauce was a bit strange and I think I prefer the normal salted kind.  The yellowtail carpaccio was nicely marinated - I always enjoy a crudo/fish carpaccio as an appetizer.  We also had the five-spiced pork belly - this left a bit to be desired as well.  I prefer my pork belly melt-in-your-mouth style and this was on the chewier side.  We also tried one of their rolls as well as their sashimi - the fish is pretty decent, but it's by no means top grade sushi.  However, it's good enough to satisfy any sushi craving.  In short, probably your best option for sushi in Uptown Charlotte, nice service, and excellent ambience/atmosphere/vibe.

PDtSre7yGhR383E6X_zdGw.text: A friend of mine raved about this restaurant, while warning me about how it gets to capacity quickly. I made plans to forgo the reservation route, and just go in right as the doors opened for the evening. I didn't quite get there when I anticipated, and I wasn't in the mood to wait, so my date and I had already chosen a backup in case we had to wait for a seat. Luckily, even with most of the chairs occupied, we were able to score a table right away.  The decor is lovely and it's a great setup to impress your date. I started off with a Lychee martini while looking over the sushi roll selection. Everyone says the potato roll is delicious, so we ordered that along with the Mermaid, and two others. All of the rolls were delicious. Typically I can decide which ones I would skip on my next visit, but they were all so good, I truly couldn't choose. I actually wish I had ordered a fifth roll.   O-Ku is a definite GO!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot &amp; Heavy, Mermaid, potato...I forgot the fourth one.

7IqpmRPAtczMkhXBzjGl9g.text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Charlotte.  The atmosphere is unique and trendy but the food is what makes it great. We started with the dumpling dim sum and wasn't disappointed.  The waitstaff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The hot and heavy roll is my favorite roll. Tuna and lobster in a sushi roll?? Unbelievable and well worth the money.  I'm excited to go back.

-2PKRXc2Yw8TBiP_cj2eCw.text: Trey was the best server! He was super sweet and attentive and explained the entire menu to us. The food was also superb. We will definitely be back!

hG2D7synqB3CMNYUIO4rRg.text: I love this place so much! Best sushi in town. I took 2 friends to dinner for their birthday and the GM brought us free dumplings and gyoza. It was such a special touch and greatly appreciated!!

V1YYOf653ux459_PcboCKA.text: TOP NOTCH EXPERIENCE!   I don't even know where to start because everything was so great. From the moment we walked in the hostess was super kind and the atmosphere was spot on! Great low lighting and beautiful tree branches. We were sat at a small table right in the middle of the restaurant but it was still quite so I didn't mind.   Our server quickly greeted us (I'm feeling horrible that I'm struggling to remember her name but I think it was Jennifer). She gave us a full run down of the menu and her favorites. She even gave us a little sample of her favorite sake to try.   We ordered very slowly, one item at a time, to pace ourselves. We decided to start with the Yellowfin Carpaccio which was so delicate and was dancing all over our tongues. Second we ordered the Duck Buns and I will tell you right now I have a major obsession with Bao buns so these were heaven!   Our server did a great job on coursing out and giving us time to enjoy and relax without feeling rushed. We then ordered one roll, the Spider roll. This roll was also very delicious and was a great portion! The last thing we ordered was the $35 sashimi platter. The presentation was beautiful. Everything tasted so fresh and clean!   We told our server early on that we were celebrating my new job and when dessert came as a special treat for us we were honored that they treated us to a creme burlee. Perfect way to round out our evening!   Overall this restaurant shot straight up to top 5 favorite in Charlotte! I am looking forward to returning and trying some more items because EVERYTHING sounded so good and it was difficult to pick just a few things!! The service that was so personalized, refined and laid back was really what took this place to the next level!!   TRY IT, YOU WONT REGRET IT!!

RXnleUhSnZYPaBDvrCIBNA.text: I had an awesome time here. I'll be forward with it - it was super busy and even with a reservation we had to wait a bit, but the food and service was well worth it.  The menu is diverse and colorful, and you can tell that you're in store for more than just a plate of sushi.  The food lived up to expectations, but they were out of a few key menu items that I was really excited about.  Will definitely eat there again, happily.

45R6k6NdnGOi5LzeETGNiw.text: This place is great. The snapper is out of this world. Love it love it love it. Amazing menu, amazing service. We sat at the sushi bar, such skilled and talented chefs! Will be coming back, no doubt!

ztyN1dBUT901ADKXcexYSg.text: Fool me once...this was our second visit to O-Ku.  While the sushi is quite good and fresh, the service leaves something to be desired.  After a first unpleasant visit ( which we chalked up to Queens Feast), we thought we'd give it another try.  We went early (5:30), and even though there were only a handful of occupied tables, the hostesses hemmed and hawed for over 5 minutes before telling us they could not offer us a table due to reservations scheduled at 6:15 and 6:30.  When we promised we wouldn't linger, they gave us a table.  We ordered right away, then waited about 35 minutes before our food started to come out.  No wonder they were worried about seating us! Our waiter never came back to check on us, and when it was time to pay, he left the check on the table (even though I was holding out my card), and then came back a long while later. The whole visit felt slow and unfriendly. Shame on me for giving O-Ku another try.

rhx67t4ukYEVBm_uV1-D0A.text: Good food but horrible service and experience. Went there with a party of 5 to celebrate a birthday on a Monday evening. We were probably one of the only 3 tables there and about the last to leave. Our waiters couldn't be bothered with working and we had to literally get out of our seat to look for our server every time we needed something (water, drinks we ordered 45 mins prior, and mix ups on small plates) I wanna say the main thing that drove me to write this review was prior to the event we  prepared and set up a small cake with a candle to be brought out to the table and the server rushed it out with no candles, no happy birthday and one spoon (lol) --- Charlotte needs less "trying" in ambiance and more service! I run into this issue anytime I wanna try a new place out in the city.  --- won't be back..

4VN218YtZ4PMYTImvJJ7Og.text: Perfect for date night! We went early to enjoy a more quiet atmosphere. We loved the decor and set up of the restaurant and the sushi was fantastic! Great service too!

pITYWkGMEzUMc4M4uxr2Pg.text: O-Ku... O-No. this place is extremely overrated and overpriced for the amount of fish to rice ratio. The appetizers were wonderful but their sushi is dreadful. We may be back for appetizers and drinks but will never order their sushi. I wanted to love it since it's so close to my home, but I'll pass.

gczJwmCin6maChD0CI7QAw.text: O-Ku is the best sushi I have had in Charlotte! I have dined here a handful of times and the quality of the food and service is always consistently great. The atmosphere of the restaurant is also gorgeous.   Favorite rolls would be tuna wrapped and the spicy rainbow (which is a newer addition to the menu.) The yellowtail app is also amazing.

tAe577_qTW7DLqxtA_fLdQ.text: Since Enso closed, was looking for a new spot in town to satisfy my pallete for sushi. Went with a group for dinner as Oku was disappointing both in food and service. The food we ordered as a group took FOREVER to make, I'm talking well over an hour. We came after 8pm so its not like it was a super busy point in the evening like 6pm is. Some of us ordered appetizers and that didn't even help lessen the irritation of getting our food served in a timely manner. If this was a place that truly cooks food fine, it take time to heat up things but this is a sushi spot and most of us ordered raw items. It could be understandable if the restaurant waited to have all the food brought to everyone at once but even that took too long. Finally, I had to have my food remade and I was even charged for something I didn't order but someone else at the table did. Multiple Mishaps absolutely deserves a negative review as I spent almost $50 on an evening that was memorable for the wrong reasons not the right ones. I definitely have to discourage people from considering here as I would have liked to know all this myself before going.

_X4sdtCdYv61-ZvxdctEBw.text: Went here for a friend's birthday dinner. We started off at the bar while we waited for the tables to be set up. He did make a reservation ahead since the size of the party was more then 10 people. The service at the bar was quick and easy to order. Their drink list was impressive and there sake list seemed good too. When they were ready to seat us, we were seated in this ackward L shape. On top of that some of our guest couldn't even sit with the main part of the table. They were given a little cocktail table for 4 people. I understand it was a big party, but the reservation was made a head of time, so i don't understand why the seating was not planned out better. While the front of the table received service, the back of the table waited about 20 mins before anyone took our drink order. When my boyfriend asked if we could put a drink order in, we were told by the waitress "not yet, I'm still counting seats". I've worked in the restaurant industry before and wouldn't tell a customer I'm still counting seats. But, cutting her some slack, she may have been new. Anyways by the time we got our drinks the other half of the party already got there main entrees. We didn't even put ours in yet. The sushi was good and we did get a cold sake which was also fine. I live close by, so I will be back and hoping for a better experience.

1mu6IDrttkb_X7dQ_TWY9g.text: Small and disappointing. Swanky atmosphere and the food was tasty - but small portions for the price and worse than average service. Go to Yama Asian Fusion - less atmosphere but way better sashimi.

Efi8MeBdsa6966BESiM8Bw.text: Wife had Table side lobster......wow!  Succulent and delicious.  Sizzled in the truffle butter until the final bite.  Unadventurous shell fish allergy me...the best teriyaki chicken and rice I've ever had.  Excellent bar keeps.  Girl and the guy working June 10th evening service both impeccable.   Bravo to ownership here.  My first 5 star rating!

pAoY4pOVTGAqwpKKzt-kRg.text: Very yummy! Great service. Is a little expensive. But the atmosphere is nice and there is an interesting selection of sushi and drinks.

7o2y55rZ7fEQy-EQpkG97w.text: Fantastic!  Dinner with 3 friends (1 who is Japanese) and another in the group who is a former restaurant owner. All 4 of us loved this place!   Menu selection:  I had the Avocado Wrapped Roll with tropical fruit salsa ($10.50 = truly tasty!  I would order again and again, each visit.  Seawood salad ($6) had a slightly different flavor with a dressing that was very pleasant.  Sushi/sashimi combo included: 9 Maguro, 18 pieces of sashimi for $50.  Excellent selection and flavor.  Presentation was appealing.   Service:  Allison was attentive, knew the menu well and was able to suggest items for me (vegetarian) and my comrades (carnivores).  The manager Kristen stopped by table too to ensure everything was great.   Excellent.   Atmosphere and interior design: very intentional.  Lighting is soft with an Edison Bulb-esque lights and modern fixtures.  Raised tables and standard height tables add to create a visually  interesting dining room.  Music -love it!  Upbeat-mood tunes at a volume that allows to both hear/ennui the beat while still hearing the conversations at your table.   Great for: date, friend-time, business meal, celebration, even "to go".    Love! Love! Love!   My new favorite restaurant in Charlotte and I visit the city frequently for business.

U6cBqO6Qfk5MGAHFpt90Gg.text: New favorite sushi spot! Cool atmosphere. Half off sushi on mon and wed 5-7. My favorite was the mermaid roll, but we also got the rainbow roll, kiwi roll and seaweed salad! All delicious

8ITEE-uW2rnga8USyG-h1A.text: Don't eat here unless you have a flashlight (lighting way too dim to read the menu), small appetite (portions might as well be kid size), and want to leave feeling dissatisfied. I had the Mermaid Roll, Salmon Lemon Roll, and Sake sashimi. The Mermaid Roll was decent at best, however the roll only had 4/5 individual tiny pieces. The Salmon Lemon Roll tastes like a Harris Teeter to go California Roll with salmon and lemon on top. The salmon in general was good quality, but was served warm. Right after eating at O-Ku, I went to a cheaper sushi place just to fulfill my appetite for larger portions at a better price. The hip atmosphere with its exposed brick and high tables could not compensate for my poor experience. Very disappointed since Charlotte Agenda highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Lemon Roll - mediocre. Salmon and slice of lemon added to mask the taste of basically a Harris Teeter to go California Roll

A3If6piOyuvTPd0FPIfp5w.text: My fav sushi place in town!! I am super picky about Japanese cuisine but o-ku is def one of the best Japanese restaurants I tried in the states. Highly recommend the wagyu nigiri and box style sushi. In terms of dessert, the green tea ice cream is just average but the tuxedo cake is phenomenal!!

QZQbK-6lxmz_5wiknpe2Og.text: So I called an order for pickup..3 sushi rolls-30min and she said that when I come in, go to the bar and they will have my order. All fine and dandy, right? I get to the restaurant 35min later and they don't have my order, she finds it sitting by the register and it hasn't even been given to the back yet. Ahhhh frustrating but okay, people make mistakes. Tells me it'll be 5min, which is frustrating in itself since she originally told me 30, but I understand maybe they'll rush the order so it'll be done faster. 25min later after sitting at the bar like a putz, I get my order. The waitress/bartender could have at least offered me a beer/water while I waited. Just a prime opportunity, to provide some customer service, wasted. Won't be coming back unfortunately. The sushi was pretty good too

NSoXb9GWkcScig72HnvWsw.text: Sushi is fresh. Just okay for price definitely worth it on 1/2 price sushi Monday and Wednesday from 5-7.

VEXUgNoA5LvEINgTCY7fug.text: Absolutely amazing! The food was beyond fantastic. Charlotte, our bartender went above and beyond! Request her if you ever go there. She made our experience! Rio was great as well! Both were very attentive.

FiXoyiCIuh8IhQyin5tTgw.text: I can't even begin to describe how amazing O-Ku is!  The fish is fresh and such a vast variety of options!  The bartenders are on top of their game and treat you right every time.  I have been so impressed by the quality, service and atmosphere!  I would recommend to any sushi lover!

fsBO75SxNNBIoeqbPc-vZQ.text: Fantastic ambiance! Low key environment and chill yet hip music helped set the mood for a relaxing evening. Environment has an industrial feel with a very Earthy feel that is zen and Tranquil. The place is clean and the sushi was fresh and well prepared. Sharp knife skills with good portion size. The restaurant's sushi brings an upscale fusion mix with some new flavor profiles that elevates the dish and enhances the pallet while not alienating the fundamentals of sushi dining. The waitstaff was attentive, pleasant, and offered great insight on menu options. Being an "out-of-towner" it was good to have a place where my group of friends could talk, relax, and enjoy a tasty meal. I would come again and would recommend!

qEjVFOQqnxdi1T5JLgQU3w.text: This is by far the best sushi in Charlotte. We started out with the spring rolls and the dipping sauce is to die for. The seaweed salad had an unexpected spice to it, but it just made it that much better. The lobster lollipop rolls were apparently amazing- I didn't have one. I ordered two maki rolls- tuna and yellowtail. These were both amazing. The quality of the fish was something you can't find anywhere else in Charlotte. Will ABSOLUTELY be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster lollipop rolls- highly recommend
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yellowtail maki roll- amazing

gCr-uclfsLQMlWh6vKXm5A.text: NYC scene with NYC prices. I gave them 4*'s because... well this isn't NY. This is an occasional treat yourself sushi place. The prices are steep and the choices are not super unique. The quality of the food is excellent. The atmosphere is pretty similar to 5 church... professional, classy. Initially, I went with a group of friends and we had a blast after we waited/hovered around the table to leave. I think we waited about 1 hour. But yeah, it was a random last minute thing. We did not have reservations. Worth checking out and seeing for yourself! The service was fantastic once we were seated.

NJzZRNamy-JrN21Jt0L4cw.text: Ate here today, after typing in Sushi on Open Table, this popped up.    We were worried when pulling up that we were underdressed, but when we arrived there were those in business casual and then some folk in panthers jerseys.  We started with the spicy edemame. Delish.  All ordered and loved the miso.  Then each were extremely satisfied with our rolls.  We'll be back. Hopefully some more veggie options will end up on the menu.  :)  Perfect for a date or happy hour: half off sushi on Monday/Wednesday.

PN3nvFYq_E1FRZJEVd7frA.text: Great decor, sushi, and friendly staff! We sat at the bar, and the bartender was super friendly and accommodating, I wish I could remember her name. I will definitely be back!

8b6tFOV373Pg209WXLyWbw.text: Great food. Excellent service. Sexy atmosphere.   We went on a Monday night for a birthday dinner. When we walked in my initial thoughts were, this place is sexy AND it is WAY too loud in here to be half full.   The hostess repeatedly asked us a ton of questions because she could barely hear us despite the fact that we were standing directly in front of her. They asked a TON of questions before seating us, including our phone number. Not sure why they needed all the info as we didn't have a reservation and didn't need to wait for a table.   Our server was excellent. Her name is Linda. We found out at the end of the night that she was in training, but she did a great job.   We had two sushi rolls: the mermaid roll and the kiwi-kani roll. The kiwi roll was fantastic. It was full of blue crab, tightly rolled, and had a sweet and salty balance I love.   We also had the curry duck. We were expecting a Thai type of entree with a large amount of sauce. Instead, it was a sliced breast with a curry marinade and some awesome eggplant. Recommend.   TL; DR: get the kiwi roll. Sit in Linda's section. Enjoy if you can hear your table mates.

oGjKnG9IqbAjNica-yArqg.text: The atmosphere is great for date night, groups, but probably not very family friendly. Service has always been consistently swift. Sushi is great and you can modify the rolls to add your own touch. We have had some saltier than desirable food here in the past which is why I wouldn't give it all 5 stars but it is certainly worth a try. Go to sushi roll is the spicy tuna crunch.

P5YvHpx6S2vpD-UxQDZ3fg.text: This was my second time dining at O-Ku.  The first time was for 1/2 price sushi night, and this time was for restaurant week. The restaurant week menu was a pre-set 3-course menu. We arrived at our reservation time at 8:30pm and were seated right away. Within 15 minutes of being seated we placed our food and drink orders. It took 1 hour and 15 minutes for the first course to arrive. The four people at my table ordered different items, and they were all 2-3 bites worth of food each. It takes another 30-40 minutes for our second course to arrive. Again, this course is 2-3 bites each. 20 minutes after that, our final course arrives. I got the waygu beef and felt that the overall quality of this dish was something I could have easily prepared for myself at home. The restaurant gave us 2 free appetizers but never apologized for the excessive wait. We paid $200 between the four of us there and left feeling hungry and dissatisfied. As I am now 0-2 in O-Ku experiences, I can not say that I will be visiting again.

rPzP501d3H65NwMF3xE9OQ.text: Restaurant fails to provide soy sauce, wasabi, ginger, chop sticks, etc with delivery service orders. Very expensive to be so cheap in providing those items.

x7LrbL2LDjC8Q4zO4ECorg.text: WOW..... we have visited several times and O-Ku does not disappoint.  The ambiance, food, and staff are first rate.  The staff is knowledgeable and polite.  Sushi is first rate. Five stars!

GZPTb-bzQwDG28Al-Z-8RQ.text: We have been to O-ku a few times and have always had a great experience, so we thought we'd bring our out of town guests here. This time there was something off from the start. Everything was delayed from our seating to items ordered, items that were ordered were served incorrect, and some items were never served. We asked for the manager and she was amazing. Everyone always has an off day and I want to thank the business for making things right. The way we were treated by management has earned our return business. Definitely the freshest Sushi in Charlotte for even the pickiest of sushi eaters.

ZNbhy9QfHwMujoxlP9btjw.text: Good but not great.  If your sushi is good we don't need soy sauce, so why are you pouring a giant bowl of it? .... oh wait I do need it!? Turns out I do. Things are under seasoned or just missing something. For drinks I did like the Tea-quilla but most others were too sweet. Lobster Temaki. First of all why anyone serves a a dish with 3 pieces is beyond me. How do I split that evenly with my friend!? (but that's just a personal irritatation) it's mostly rice, you can't taste the lobster which kind of defeats the purpose. The potato roll was pretty good, but poorly executed. The potato (exterior) was a little over fried, rice was mushy. Seemed like a cool idea. We had a few other dishes too but you get the idea. I was hoping for at least one "oh, wow, how did they do that?" moment for the price point, but it just didn't deliver. Honestly all of the issues come down to the rice being too mushy and things being underseasoned. The fish seemed fine but without the rice being right everything just ends up bleh.

XzgG7uW6Mi0FGrDY2MCgrQ.text: Overpriced for portions, but tasty.   Some of the smallest dishes I have been served and at some of the highest prices for what's given. However, taste was not a letdown. Hostess was friendly, server a little awkward.  Cool vibe though not a fan of darkness and wood, gives a cheap tavern feel. Windows on left side on building when walking in are interesting.

vNEPCJ-gcFgU86zIDutSlw.text: Amazing sushi and wonderful service! I highly recommend you make a reservation tho - I came here with a friend on a Tuesday and there was a 30 minutes wait. I was running a little late so my friend received a complimentary yellow tail carpacio from the manager. We ordered the Bourbon tea and lychee martini and they were delicious but not too strong. I had the sushi sashimi platter ($35 version) and my friend had the tempura roll and sauteed veggies. I was quite impressed with the quality of the fish. They are up to par with other Michelin star sushi restaurants but you don't break the bank here (MF sushi in Houston comes to mind)! While we waited for our food, the waiter dropped a couple of appetizers: the shumai and dumplings combo and their version of bang bang shrimp - all complimentary of the house! I'm typically not a fan of bang bang shrimp because of the batter and the small shrimp inside of the batter but their version was big and so fresh and not overcoated with batter - I'd actually recommend this app and will get it next time! My sushi sashimi combo: I asked the waiter to serve only fish on my plate (take away any sweet tamago, fish ore, steamed shrimp and all the nonsense) and he delivered without charging me a dime extra! There was a crab stick sushi that I thought I'd dislike but it was so tasty since the crab was REAL snow crab (yum!) The atmosphere is a great fine dining, perfect for a nice date and for important business outing. Based on the quality of the food, the cost, the service and the ambiance, this place easily earns a 5 star!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi sashimi combo ($35 version) worth every single penny! The quality of fish is comparable to other Michelin star sushi restaurants.
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shumai and dumplings app (left) and their version of bang bang shrimp (right)

dzKF0rGo7p9YSkAn_5M00w.text: Best sushi in charlotte. The salmon nigiri is a must have, great drinks and the chili oil edamame!!!

qrPzgSBT0eo1713JyoJTbA.text: My favorite sushi place in Charlotte! Really nice atmosphere and good drinks!! The staff are great too, awesome customer service

BVdklS-rPMQrlbyc5zrrXg.text: This place is the best sushi place in Charlotte! I have been to over 10 sushi places and this one tops them all with their quality of sushi and service.

6EfEL_ekWkbxPbDeSiAXrg.text: This is a very trendy, upscale sushi experience. We very much enjoyed all of our food, especially the ones that were on the Half Price options on Monday & Wednesay nights. The servers are very attentive and well versed on the menu. I personally prefer Ru Sans because I'm a Die-hard fan for life...but O-ku was definitely a wonderful fancy, date night experience

OXOehnNdWImJDK8WEtq5RA.text: Excellent food. There is nothing that isn't good on the menu. Best sushi place I've ever been too!

ssmVNWCKvgHP75HFK0okgg.text: Came here opening night and during restaurant week, both times we had great service and the food was fantastic. Highly recommend the yellowtail carpaccio or dumpling dim sum to start. Our favorite rolls are the salmon and lemon roll, mermaid roll, and potato roll.

8wHet5TbzpK1QmkU3_x5Rw.text: This place is impressive in every area... the hostess' greeting when you walk in, the skill and friendliness of the bartenders, the quality and value of the food (especially with the sushi specials on Wednesday!) and even the VERY impressive  bar manager (Larisa) introducing herself and making sure everything is OK.  I had my first visit recently, and will be back very often.  There are many choices to eat/have a drink in Charlotte and I put this place at the very top.  Keep up the great work ladies and gents!!

cE4jXPph4ajrfBfKfups8A.text: I really enjoyed happy hour! I got the lemon salmon, the rainbow roll, spider, tuna, negitoro, and negihama. Negitoro was my favorite. We also tried the duck bao buns. The Wagyu sashimi is so delicious and savory. It was worth the money for the one piece. The Wagyu also has a certificate from japan. Everything came out pretty fast and we sat at the sushi bar since there were no tables. So probably make a reservation, parking was also a little hard to find.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

XPaQexsEdANEAcj0gjJWTQ.text: Sushi craving successfully satisfied! First time for me at O-Ku and I was very happy when I left. I ordered some yellowtail nigiri which was like butter and oh so delicious, followed by a Spicy Tuna Crunch Roll. Both items were very fresh and very yummy.  The vibe in this joint is on point for dinner. It's dark and modern and was great for a girl's night out. Can't wait to come back to try more!

2xx2MNAgRpGddAC9MhueZg.text: Finally getting around to checking this place out, and it did not disappoint!  The sushi can be a bit pricey, so I highly recommend going on Mon/Wed from 5-7 for half off sushi rolls!  I ordered the tuna wrapped tuna roll, and the spider roll and it was the perfect amount of food for me.  The spider roll was my favorite, with amazing flavor. And the tuna wrapped tuna roll was also delicious.  I also recommend the spicy edemame - some of the best I've had!  Ambiance is great, with a great vibe in a low light dining area. I love the industrial Edison bulbs they've used for their lighting, it's very neat.  The also offer a complimentary valet.  This is a perfect date night spot in South End.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

YmKWtDAfapIDVMdNvTbyQg.text: My husband and I dined at O-Ku on a Monday night for 1/2 price sushi. The ambiance is awesome, service was great, and the food was yummy.   I must say the sushi rolls are small (about 1/2 the size of what you can expect to get elsewhere). They are tasty though! We also enjoyed their cocktail menu.   If your looking for ambiance come here, if your looking to be filled up go elsewhere.

C-Yh73ddeT1OdYzHw4em4Q.text: Sushi review: I have officially been convinced to add this place to my list of regular sushi joints! Around town, I stick to the sushi places I know and love, which are usually owned by the same people. But O-Ku's Monday and Wednesday half off specialty sushi rolls special, and their fresh seafood and tasty creations have made this spot my new go-to!  The ambiance is pretty, dimly lit, and a little romantic, so it's a good date spot or happy-hour spot with friends. Parking can get tricky so it's good to come here before peak eating times.  When it comes to the sushi menu: for crunch and savoriness I go with the Potato Roll -- who wouldn't love their sushi wrapped in thinly sliced fried potato, honestly? For a fresh, crisp taste on the palate I go with the Red Dragon. But with my experience here it seems you really can't go wrong!  I'm a wine drinker, so they've got a handful of wines by the glass for me to drink with my sushi. They also have by the bottle, beers, and signature cocktails.   They have other food besides sushi but I come here for the sushi!   Have a food allergy? They're super accommodating!  Even when the sushi isn't half price it runs about the same price as it's more reasonably priced competitors (unlike Nikko). It's hard to find a sushi place that has rolls outside of California and Phillys on half special. Thank you, O-Ku, for bringing creative, fresh sushi to this city at a reasonable price!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato Roll

98VoFCLWvS1JkPsBSoLgHA.text: We went for Queen's Feast, and we got these selections.  Add On: Duck Buns - toasted brioche style bun with good combined flavor but the duck in its own had no noticeable flavor. Lychee Matinee - good balance of tart and sweet, with actual lychee garnish  First course... Yellowtail carpaccio - robust, spicy, dynamic *my favorite of the two* White Fish Crudo - very mild, light lemon flavor with olive oil  Second course... Wagyu Fritters (croquettes) - not appealing at all. Sent back and switched for shrimp Poke Bowl - mostly squid which was chewy (and actually tasted more like a mussel or other bivalve), not a lot of tuna, seaweed salad was good, bit of mango got completely lost in the mix. South End Shrimp - *favorite of this course* Delicious flavor, just spicy enough, perfectly cooked shrimp, and peanuts added great texture.  Third Course... (We both got the two sushi rolls option) Rainbow Roll - solid roll, but nothing special Tuna Wrapped Roll - good flavor contrast with the cucumber Red Dragon Roll - good flavor, good heat, good amount of crunch *my favorite* Spider Roll - spicy, a bit of crunch, very different from traditional spider rolls we've had in the past.  Unfortunately our second course came out at the same time as our sushi, so our tiny 2-person table was pretty crowded. Service was friendly, but the restaurant was very cold. (Most patrons, including us, had their coats on the entire time.)  All in all, our meal was good, but I wouldn't call it great. Nothing wow-ed us to a point where we would come back (especially for these prices!) since it's pretty out of the way for us. But if friends wanted to come here, I wouldn't mind coming back. For our part, the appetizers are really where they shine.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. South End Shrimp (Queen&#39;s Feast - Second Course)
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spider Roll (Queen&#39;s Feast - Third Course)
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna Wrap sushi (Queen&#39;s Feast - Third Course)

igNZNbsjAnbPGo4-60_6dw.text: I have lived in Charlotte for 13 years and I can honestly say that O-Ku has the absolute best sushi in this city. I make it habit to attend their half off happy hour on Mondays and Wednesdays AT LEAST twice a month. I have introduced everyone I know to this place and have never met a disappointed soul. It can be hard to snag a table during happy hour so I suggest making a reservation prior to coming.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red dragon and spider roll

Yms7NbYAxEYoo-HkynzhrA.text: I wish they included a list of the Japanese whiskeys they have even if it's just a few because it's loud and busy at the bar and I'm old and blind and can't read the labels.  So at our table I ordered whatever the waitress recommended and it turned out to be Hakushu on the rocks which is $28 so I kinda flipped my wig when I saw it on the bill.  Anything over $8 or $10 for a drink should come with a verbal confirmation of the price.  It tastes like Jack Daniels mixed with Teachers Highland Cream which is ok but not great.  I always forget Japanese whiskey tastes like bourbon.  But regardless it was a weak pour and the ice was melted by the time it got to the table.  Traditional edamame is the only way to go. Anything else is sacreligious. House salads are huge! Definitely share.  The crudo is a little heavy on the line juice but still good. Great finish.  Dim Sum appetizer is Japanese gyoza and shumai. Tye shumainis the clear winner. Tasty and lots of character. We kep the sauces for whatever came next they were so good.    The hot n heavy roll is really good!  Nigiri are a little sad and should be enjoy d before you tackle everything piled on the exotic roles.   Unisex bathrooms, two and still a line because they are individual use of course.

T1ejzN_li7b8CkR32rbR0w.text: Sushi rolls was really good and reasonably priced. The waitress was very helpful in her recommendations and answering any questions we had with the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

1NvmUWLStXmOHR5GlCebuw.text: It's really the best sushi spot in town. The vibe, and most importantly (for me anyway) the food is so great.

kvDGdR34JoLM_A4g0nTjZQ.text: Beast mode sushi. So, this is my second time here. This time my wife and I shared the Spicy Rainbow roll, the hot and heavy roll, the red dragon roll and the potato roll. Though the hot and heavy was my favorite (and my wife's favorite) everything we had was great. Also, each roll tasted different. I love sushi, but two drawbacks to sushi can be 1 one roll is usually not enough to fill me, so I end up breaking the bank getting multiple rolls just for me and 2. Some places have rolls that all mostly taste the same. However, each sushi roll was distinct and delicious.  They have a Monday and Wednesday happy hour with half off sushi. Which is a great deal. One caveat is that the hot and heavy (the best one) is still full price.  Last time we came we tried several things, including the Lobster Temaki, the Yellow tail carpaccio, and the tartare.  Nothing disappointed. The atmosphere is cool and trendy.  Our server this time was a little slow, but overall, this is strong choice for sushi. The ambiance makes O-Ku a great place to impress a date.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. The potato roll
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Red dragon, the hot and heavy and the spicy rainbow

99JkbLx5HOjzKS_6fQFRmw.text: I can't keep up with the amount of national holidays associated with our calendar year. O-ku offered their Monday & Wednesday happy hour special on National Sushi Day (November 1st).  There sushi happy hour features half-off off 90% of their rolls (only one roll is not included, it's because it cost a whopping $25).   Go on a Monday or Wednesday, bring three friends and order ever roll. guaranteed a good time. The lighting is dim so don't be surprised if you need the flash to take pictures of your food.

ROlbbN6He2VafGQseTxJRQ.text: The food here is phenomenal! The sushi was so fresh and the service was amazing. I recommend the salmon and lemon roll and the spicy rainbow roll-- best sushi I've had in a while.

et7YY_7ETyXVK9IqCk8b3Q.text: Meet up with some girlfriends for drinks and appetizers. Saturday night special. I moved here from California 18 months ago and remember my first experience here was through the roof. I ended up at Tibor Creek with the staff for last call LOL! Again the food and service at the bar was excellent. Chelsea my bartender was top notch. My girlfriends ordered like there was no tomorrow, mean while I decided to only get a few appetizers. Their food came out nice and quick, noticed that my appetizers would take a bit longer - Chelsea offered me a free drink, talk about great customer service! 30 minutes later my appetizers came out at a lower than expected standard- the GM Apollo - with the Born in America tattoo took it upon himself to ask the wonderful kitchen staff as they were shutting down to promptly redo the order - with no haste the food came out at a 5 Star  quality- I always get the fresh wasabi here too so it was even that much better. Want to thank and extend my gratitude to the management and staff for such a great experience! I don't know why I don't come here more often, but I will now ! Thanks Apollo for going above and beyond the call of duty ! My friend CJ appreciates the bday bottle, made her night

v-BYzVEXkQ7IzCwSOGrfeQ.text: Mermaid roll: salmon, scallop, avocado, tempura fried, eel sauce, spicy aioli, scallions.... Can you find the salmon lol? Great sushi if you like rice!!! There's no salmon really nor anything else. Ugh. So disappointing

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mermaid roll: salmon, scallop, avocado, tempura fried, .... Can you find the salmon lol? Great sushi if you like rice!?!? Ugh.

rm6FDBThw_z8bn8xpR-8Dg.text: I would consider O-Ku the more upscale sushi restaurants Charlotte has to offer. The atmosphere is definitely classy and the service was great. I do understand the vibe they are going for with the  very low lighting but it was a much in my opinion.   The sushi was all delicious and the rolls were large.  I would recommend the spicy tuna roll. The prices are higher than most sushi spots in Charlotte but you are in a classy atmosphere and receiving superior service. They do have half off rolls on Monday and Wednesday if ordered during happy hour.   It gets quite crowded so I would recommend getting a reservation. The parking lot is small and a  pain to get in and out of. They do offer valet parking.

9rmrNqnzNKkoruWJqdo0VA.text: Great ambiance , great rolls , Sushi Chef Very friendly. Asked him to give me 1 of 6 of his freshest fish. Excellent choices. the only complain i have is that size are small when comparing other comparable restaurant with same cost.   Service was excellent for first half and then it got busy and I saw less attention and longer waits .

6tBloanAq3ytb1eY3sVJiQ.text: If you want a girls night out or a nice date night, this is a great place to go. It's best to make a reservation as the dining is limited, however, they do have a community table but it's really wide so it's difficult to have a date night there- but great for a group of friends. Luckily we were able to grab seats near the sushi bar which was a lot quieter. The manager walking around, blonde/tall female, was very personable and on top of things. There was a lot of teamwork which made everything run smoothly. The entire place is decorated amazingly. Tall ceilings, modern decor, low lighting.   The chili edame were by far the best I've had. The ho

RVNst2yQQxWI7nrYyWh3WQ.text: Cute sushi bar located in the Atherton Mill plaza. 1/2 off sushi rolls on Wednesday nights for only a few hours during dinner time. Be sure to make a reservation as they get busy! The inside is spacious and there were plenty of space to stand at the bars! Parking was difficult to find in the plaza, so be sure to look for parking a few blocks away or walk or scoot! The veggie tempura roll and  spicy tuna crunch roll were delicious! Good place for a date night, girls night, or when you just need a night out of the house!

g8Q3h93x3GNrRzUaYC7vug.text: Great ambience , great rolls , not so excited about the chef specialties . Service was excellent for first half and then it got busy and I saw less attention and longer waits . ( ordered two things and it wasn't enough !)  Rainbow and dragon roll were amazing !

eXiZvmR8OK37lEVOyow_2g.text: Sweetie and I wanted to try something different for our anniversary and we like sushi, so why not go and see what all the fuss is about?  I made a reservation on OpenTable for a Friday night, 6:30 so I didn't have to wait in the line that was sure to be formed by then and off we go.  I got the obligatory reminder call on Friday afternoon by a pleasant lady which is always a nice touch.  We showed up and they had free valet parking which is a nice touch since nothing is worse than parking your own car and having to find a spot at a hot, new restaurant where everyone else is.  Walked in to a nicely decorated, well thought out space.  So dark I had to use my cell flashlight for the menu.  Nice music playing and servers were plentiful.  We got a nice hightop near the front door which was a nice table to start but as the restaurants filled up the overflow from the bar with people waiting for seats got a bit annoying as I really could care less about the guy this lady picked up on Tinder but was forced to listen to because she stood right near my table.  Our server was nice, attentive and was good at what he did.  I'm not a drinker so I usually order Iced Tea and come to find out they don't have Iced Tea on the menu.  WTF?  This is an outrage, all "sushi places" have Iced Tea.  Besides, this place originated in Charleston SC, the birthplace of Iced Tea and they're in the south for crying out loud.  This must change, now.  Anyway, I sipped on Charlotte's finest tap water instead.    Appetizer was the O-Ku Spring Roll which I highly recommend.  Nice selection of fish, some wonton crisps for added crunch and an outstanding sesame sauce for dipping.  Well done!  I grade a sushi place by the innovative specialty rolls and frankly O-Ku needs to beef it up, they only have about dozen on the menu and not too many standouts.  We had a Rainbow, Kiwi Kani, and Mermaid.  The Kiwi Kani fit the bill of innovative, and was delicious, the addition of the fresh kiwi made the roll and it was wonderful.  Dare I say one of the best rolls in the Queen City.  I noticed on the menu that they had fresh wasabi, not the green dyed horseradish that most have.  Come to find out they were out.  Here we go again, no Tea and no fresh wasabi?  Our Server suggested the pickled wasabi instead which was different and I must say, excellent.  Added a different dimension to the meal.  We finished with an almond cake or something and it was a nice cap to the meal.  I liked O-Ku.  They're still new but if you're looking for a new "See and be seen" place this is it.  Nicely done place with good food.

sB_OSoQHp1SioCA-zE4-3w.text: This is by far the most amazing sushi spot in the city. Chef Boi is amazing as well as our server Liz. Can't wait to come back and eat this delicious food

ZITMj74LW9soT8zeJWhYUg.text: Just not impressive. As a note we have a place where we live that has an exceptional sushi chef. We went there based on an article ranking it as 7th best in Charlotte. Started with sashimi chef choice. First problem was that it was certainly the fish that had some age on it. Didn't taste fresh.  Second issue is that if I had independently ordered what was brought, it would have been less. No value in chef's poor choice.  Wife ordered the chicken teriyaki, which was dry and overcooked.  The texture reminded me of Tyson's precooked chicken.    The flounder sashimi was good so they get a second star. They charge a premium price but deliver a basic cut of fish.

mV1bymN_OCz-4QL-EcAXGw.text: ehh! If I had to sum up my review in one phrase I'd say that the fanciness of the venue is offset by the mediocre food & service, and less than average drinks. I was here with a couple friends one Saturday night, and the place was packed. Loud and lively, it's a great spot for a big group on a weekend. We started off with some drinks, and while I can't remember what everyone at our table ordered, I do remember that no one loved their cocktail. I'd recommend sticking with sake, beer or wine! The food presentation was lovely... nothing out of the ordinary though - flavor wise. The service was slow that evening, but in general the staff seemed very nice and courteous. There are a handful of comparable spots in Charlotte.

nOScsjpH_bjJL54HHPjrbQ.text: My husband and I ate here last night. The food is always great but the expediting is terrible. We saw our meal sitting out for a solid 10 minutes before it was brought over to us after it had been cooked. The dumplings were lukewarm. If they had just sent them out early (they are an app) then they would have been better. I would rather have my food staggered and warm, than all together and cold. There were also 4 people standing over by where the food comes out chatting and goofing off with some guy sitting at the sushi bar. The wait staff has 0 sense of urgency, but would go back for the food.

w6dp4z4DkreCuC7sSLfDCA.text: I'm definitely a fan!  The SouthEnd neighborhood has been begging for quality sushi!  The interior of O-Ku is super modern with a warm and cozy feel.  It's super clean and the bar service was excellent and friendly as we awaited our OpenTable reservation to be seated.  I think O-Ku would warrant 5 stars but the service was quite slow.  Table service was nearly full but tables seemed to turn at a reasonable rate.  We placed an order for 2 rolls and the Yellowtail app, knowing we'll order more as that arrives.  We then opted to put in our 2nd and 3rd order after waiting 45 minutes.  Our first course didn't arrive until 70 minutes into our seating.  Back to the food though!  The yellowtail was incredible.  It's plated with a sliver of Serrano Pepper but it wasn't overly hot.  Excellent balance with the heat and the other flavors.  We also had the Firecracker and Black Dragon rolls.  Both were phenomenal.  If you haven't given this new spot a shot, nows the time.  The newness has died down and you won't find better sushi within a decent radius.

wgEAxUszAvl40FP-GsAYdw.text: 2nd time back to this place after the first bad experience.  Much better.  Liked to the atmosphere, which is comparable to a posh NYC sushi restaurant.  I would go back for sure, either for a date or birthday.

GbLdDhW9gJ60KzSR2yD18w.text: Absolutely delicious. Great environment, with a definite decor, enough to feel cool but not overwhelming or overrated.

sNvAtZ8-COA1vdU3lPLv6g.text: Great atmosphere for dining for a special occasion.  Neat cocktails.  Appetizers are interesting.  We got the dim sum and wagyu tartare.  The dim sum disappeared but I was the only one that liked the tartare.  The other two I went with didn't like the consistency.  We all got sushi for dinner.  The green eggs and hamachi sushi is very flavorful but word to the wise - it has asparagus in it so if u don't like asparagus, might wanna avoid it.  We sat at the bar and the service was decent until around 8:15 when they started getting super busy.  Basically there was a second line of people around the bar and understandably the two bartenders had trouble keeping up.    All in all, great experience but the reason I gave it a four is because of the price.  I definitely think this place has great food and decent service but I'm not sure the cost is justified.  You're definitely paying for the atmosphere here (and maybe the cocktails) because I would certainly make the argument that ru sans down the street has sushi that's arguably just as flavorful (and many, many more sushi options) for half the price.  So if you're not interested in a date night or trying to impress someone at a hip new restaurant, I'd go there.

k3OYCNjGkCKmmW8U9Z1nCg.text: The best sushi place in the QC!!!!   I'm very picky about sushi and have found my new go to place.   The customer service is on point and the atmosphere is spot on.   It's a great place to grab a sushi roll, a drink with friends, or a whole meal!  I highly suggest truffle edamame, seaweed salad, white fish crudo (personal fav), spring roll, miso soup, and the potato roll.   I can't speak highly enough about the amazing culture, food, and friendliness of this restaurant.   Kimball, you have brought the sushi scene in Charlotte to a whole new level. From one business owner to another, 6 out of 5 stars! Superb!   Y'all won't want to miss out on this place! I promise you won't be disappointed and you won't find a better sushi place in the whole city!

Vj-vic3bS5vjQ7NQHLVWtw.text: came here last night for my birthday! we had a party of about 9 people! the service was amazing! they got all our food correct and recommended a lot of good things since none of us have been here. Drinks were amazing and so was the food. will definitely be back!

xKiM0pN6RGwtMoamsxn7uA.text: The decor at O-ku is enough to make you want to dine at this unique establishment. Dimly lit and servers in all black give it the feel of fine dining. The appetizer edamame in truffle oil was fantastic. We also ordered the dumpling dim sum which was suggested by our knowledgeable waiter, Tony and it was an excellent choice . I ordered the chicken teriyaki with fried rice. I have to say it is the best fried rice ever! All others at the table ordered sushi and it looked and tasted amazing. We will definitely be back our next time in Charlotte.

cz2zfHEUR8_tAdLo5pTt6w.text: Place reeks of truffle oil. We were given a 1.5hr wait time since we didn't have a reservation... it was a total bougie ploy to make it look exclusive, which they can't pull off when you can clearly see 6+ open small tables behind the hostess stand. Thanks for turning us away - Ru Sans was really great tonight.

z_DbKimQ9MEKFVFxwrjmsQ.text: This is really a 5 for the food. Across the board amazing decor. Nice vibes. Our waitress was good but some of the supporting crew was not very good.  Have to admit that Im quite particular about service being that I'm a NYer. (And I've visited Japan a few times)  Definitely now one of my favorite sushi spots in Charlotte

cnAssvaQN8Au7P01lrWg6g.text: This restaurant blew me away with their service! I got a reservation for two (recommended) for my wife and I's anniversary. The whole staff came over to our table at different points to wish us a happy anniversary and they all came bearing gifts: champagne to toast, sashimi appetizer, and coconut creme brulee for dessert! The manager himself, Robert, came over to personally wish us a happy anniversary. Everything we ordered was amazing and the ambiance is great for date night/get togethers with friends. If you enjoy sushi and outstanding service, this place is a must while in Charlotte!

TGCGNe2HpRYz-Cz0yLSAcA.text: Love the atmosphere and the food is good, but service is SO SLOW. It's like the waiters are trying to keep us hostage here. The waiter also forgot to ask me for my order... I had to go up to her and remind her that I hadn't ordered. Don't come here if you have any plans after, you'll be trapped all night!

mADTl0zXPwSmvhI_8w4H7A.text: The atmosphere was good and so was the food but it was so loud in there really couldn't enjoy my time with friends.

E-ScSt560wIWgyEjsXW2eA.text: O-KU never disappoints. Our waitress was amazing. She gave us recommendations and we tried them and everything was phenomenal. I love that the plates are shareable and always full of funky flavors. Its a great place for a special occasion and for a different take on sushi. I couldn't recommend this place enough.

uqBco2d95Hoc_f3HRkeWGA.text: The food is delicious. Really good sushi. The inside of the restaurant is also very pretty with wood branches on the columns. We had the spring roll which are very good. And I highly recommend the kiwi Kano roll, it has kiwi and it's delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kiwi Kani roll

pGcEykF8rj69Ni9B0rx8Gw.text: I was really excited to try o-Ku after seeing it on a best sushi list. Some of the rolls were decent, but overall very underwhelming. Especially not worth the price. I hate to give a bad review, but I was just unimpressed.  My husband and I really disliked the potato roll-- I Love sushi and I love French fries, but the combination was awful.  I will say it's a great atmosphere and great service though.

IALrbFtyJgWLF6NjNrwL_w.text: If I were you... Skip the coffee a few times in the next couple weeks, save up that money, and TREAT YO SELF to some orgasmic sushi.   This place isn't so fancy where I felt out of place, but the service made it feel really fancy. The server brought a tray of additives (like lemons, limes, cucumbers) to put in the water.  We got the bao, wagyu sashimi, and otoro sashimi, and a few rolls. I'm going to roll past the rolls - they were honestly surprisingly common and mediocre...  But I didn't care because the sashimi they put together was just unreal. I could seriously eat a few dozen pieces of their sashimi. It was high quality fish, and exceptional pairing of flavors. The most delicate of umashi or lemon flavors in the most perfect of bites.  I'm so hungry thinking about it. Do it. Now.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna and salmon sashimi and some roll.

smpA7SrRMFID25hz_zpWCA.text: Top notch sushi. Their menu offers a variety of rolls, perfect for when you want to try something new with something familiar. I have yet to go wrong with any of the rolls I've had here. All have been outstanding. The cocktails are quite good as well.   Unless you have a reservation, be prepared to wait - but rest assured, it is worth it.

kIV8mlIqZee2dcA7Sm7sTQ.text: Sugar spice was the perfect cocktail as I loved passion fruit.   Salmon lemon roll was perfect. I asked for some spicy aioli and added it myself to the roll.   Spicy Rainbow was tasty but if you like simple delicious food it was too many things in one bite so it was not a clean fast where you can taste the fish as much. But if you like sushi with a lot of sauce and mix of thing it may speak to you.   2 rolls plus carpaccio was too much food for me. Go for 1 app plus 1 roll per person.

Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy rainbow roll at the back, salmon lemon roll up front
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sugar and spice

1HoSkFh3Nggmgt51EvEquQ.text: O-Ku is a trendy spot to get your fill of fresh and eclectic sushi, washed down with designer drinks and surrounded by a bustling atmosphere.  With a party more than two I would recommend reservations because this place was slammed.  Service was slower than I think it should have been but the staff was attentive and very cordial.  We ordered an array of dishes ranging from edamame with chili sauce and tofu for apps to blue crab carpaccio and sushi sampler for two as entrees.  All of it tasted fresh and was beautifully presented.  The tofu stuck out in my mind as probably the best I've had however, that's not at a discount of the fillets of fish served with the sushi sampler.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining room view

6JDECXv1DjZuUNhlcId1wQ.text: Their buy one, get one sushi on Mondays and Wednesdays is so good!! Make sure to either get there early (they'll put you at the "community table") or make a reservation, even if it's just for a weekday evening. I'm not sure I'd pay full price for the sushi, but the buy one, get one is so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

uqUbj5C2sn_VwqRHQJmgmg.text: Beautiful layout and decor as you walk in. The lighting is really dark. We came for late dinner (9pm) there wasn't a wait. Service was quick and suggestive.   We came in a group of 5. Everyone ordered a little of everything. It was our first time, so we all shared here and there.  Portions were very small for a very high price. Everyone ordered a good amount of food, so we all did fill up evenly. All the food had amazing flavor!

UhRshjuQtn9pD-JN-CquAg.text: One of the most pleasant Sashimi experiences I have had in a long time.  I ordered the $50 sashimi platter.  It was fantastic.   I have included three pictures.   When presented to me, the chef came to my side and explained each items on the platter. He did an outstanding job.    The GM, Apollo, was quite attentive throughout my dining experience.    This is now on my "definitely return" list.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States

M8gguP1zH9MDIUGq7YigKg.text: My ladies took me here on Wednesday (2/13) two nights ago for my birthday dinner... luckily, we had reservations... I'm 100% certain we would not have been seated otherwise as this place has obviously earned a well-deserved reputation with Charlotte foodies!  They were packed and the parking lot was no different... fear not, though, they had a wonderful young man working valet outside.  He was getting it done, somehow!!  We were seated quickly, and I started with the Bourbon Berry Basil Lemonade... it was so good, I ordered it twice (because why drink one when you could drink two for double the price?!)!    Given that it was 1/2 price sushi night, we ordered rolls for days... Salmon & Lemon, Mermaid, Red Dragon, Hot & Heavy, Potato, and Rainbow rolls were all phenomenal... The Salmon Nigiri (with truffle chive creme fraiche and lemon zest) is to die for... the South End Shrimp and Dumpling Dim Sum are heaven... and, if you have space in your belly, please please please try the edamame with truffle oil... I'm not sure how anyone can eat a meal here and not roll out feeling like they need new pants... The sushi was perfection, fresh, and well worth the price...   I cannot wait to come back and spoil myself here... so happy that my girls spoiled me too!  MUCH love for O-Ku Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon basil berry lemonade!
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. A lovely place!

oz5JmoX0FYr_HUEkRwUoPQ.text: Color me impressed! Fine dining and sushi combined to perfection.  Admittedly I don't know all that much about sushi - But I do know what tastes good and I know enough to leave the ordering to Tonya and John when I'm in unfamiliar territory.  Salmon Lemon Roll is close to the most awesome thing ever - rapidly followed by Spider Roll, Spicy Tuna and Vegetable Tempura.  Beautiful presentations - amazing flavors - fantastic relaxing atmosphere. And... very polished professional wait staff who would love to sell you a nice $90 bottle of wine but doesn't make a face when you order Jasmine tea...  I really like this place... a lot ... it's settled then ... I'm bringing my mom for Salmon Lemon Roll and Chirashi Sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spider roll, vegetable tempura and spicy tuna

dKlgCeZzaLK4T3YgfsDVDQ.text: We were promptly sat at our reservation time.  Thankful for valet for a busy parking lot.  Everyone very friendly.    Loved having a choice of what to put in our water-our table went for cucumber and lime.  We started with two orders of edamame- Himalayan Salt and Truffle Oil and Chili spiced.  Chili had a bit of heat and good but MAN oh MAN get the truffle flavored one- Bowl was empty super fast by all of us.   Sushi came out fast for a Friday night.  Fresh, nice presentation.    Decor is attractive and eclectic.  Enjoyable experience all around.

QOvDqRiymqVwNBs-2bpFdw.text: We went here for dinner tonight and we were all very pleased with what we ordered. Our waiter was really attentive and suggested some great options. The green eggs and hamachi and red dragon were two of our favorites and so was the spicy rainbow roll. We will be back.

sdNJNcLJwmP4bpkAJJ-iXg.text: Came here for dinner on half off night. For two people, we ordered four rolls, uni, and hamachi sashimi. Pretty cool that they fly the uni in and only have a limited amount. It was my first time trying it and can definitely say that I am not uni person. I highly recommend the spicy rainbow, salmon lemon, and dragon rolls. I was happy with the 50% off price, but on any other day the rolls seem overpriced.

nrOkRuA4-lBnG5LFBXOGFw.text: This place is awesome!!! Some of the freshest sushi I've ever had. Overall experience was wonderful. Be sure to request Dylan as your waiter. He had the best food recommendations for some first timers.

SHpBfQiIfc6PPItlyx5VVQ.text: Best sushi in Charlotte. Pricey but worth it. Beautiful restaurant and all sushi rolls are delicious. Love this place

8NEbxOFhWVe58zkSV_ikrw.text: So, I have a bad habit of looking at the menu before arriving at the restaurant. But the menu online is a bit different than what you get in person.   As a vegetarian, I was super nervous that there wouldn't be any veggie options (based on the online menu), but as soon as we were seated, our waitress told us they were able to substitute some rolls for veggies and that there were also appetizers that were veggie-friendly. Before we ordered, our waitress poured our waters. And then another lady came around with a tray full of fruit/veggie slices and asked which we would like in our waters. Whoa. I LOVED THAT!  So, my bf and I ordered the 'South End Tofu' for apps. I ordered the Potato Roll (minus all the meat) with cucumbers as the substitute (already came with avocado, fried sweet potato, and carrot). My boyfriend ordered the Potato Roll as is (with the meat). The South End Tofu was the BOMB . COM!!!! So so so so so delicious. And my potato roll was equally delicious. My mouth is watering at the thought of it. I would 100% recommend, and I would also love to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato rolls (vegetarian) = bombbbbb
Photo of O-Ku Sushi - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu - amazingggggg

QhkNP95qwdQH3CEH_X2ruw.text: I am a sushi fan and I must say, the Black Magic hakozushi was amazing. The blend of fish with the squid ink provides a distinct earthy flavor. Paired with a miso soup and lychee martini, it is a little piece of heaven.   Our bartender and server was very knowledgeable and suggested great menu items for us both. I am very picky about sushi but I would recommend O-Ku.   Call ahead or make a reservation on weekends. They tend to keep a crowd.

tmJq5svVWMicuVksVyn3iQ.text: The inside design and set up of this place is visually pleasing for sure! This was my first time and we came for restaurant week! All of the dishes were delicious and the quality of food that came out matched the ambience. My only complaint would be that the menu online for restaurant week did not match the menu at the restaurant. Specifically the wagyu tartare was said to have a quail egg on top online. This was not the case in the restaurant. As small of a thing as this may seem, I was really looking for that addition to the great dish. I feel as though this would be a good place to do an Omakase, however, if you are more of a sushi roll person, their rolls lacked a uniqueness I look for.
